summary.p: This manuscript contains a diagram of a Mahāyāna Buddhist pantheon, beginning with the ekāmnāya at the top, consisting of Upāya, Ādibuddha, and Mahāvairocana, followed by the ekāmnāyī, consisting of Prajñā and Prajñāpāramitā. It concludes with the navāmnāya, listing the nine principle disciples. The names are contained in circles, in a hierarchical structure resembling a pagoda of 35 levels.

Below each level there are verses in anuṣṭubh metre, either a stotra or a mnemonic relating to the names of that level. There is occasionally a commentary on the verses, written to the left and right of the diagram, resembling a vertical version of a tripāṭha layout. Labels for each level are also given in the left and right margins (only levels 1-15 are given a label in the left margin).

The diagram corresponds exactly to the one published by Brian Houghton Hodgson in 1835. His diagram seems to have been based on a Nepalese manuscript now preseved at the British Library (IO 7728), the incipit of which contains the same verse and commentary as this manuscript. Hodgson's manuscript has the title Buddhāmnāyānāṃ patrāṇi, and a note in his hand dates it to June 1827.

The same diagram and verses, without commentary, can also be seen in BnF Sanscrit 16, which was sent by Hodgson to Eugène Burnouf (Filliozat 1941, 9). That manuscript bears the title Âmnâyas bouddhiques.

msItem.title: Buddhāmnāya
msItem.incipit: niraṃjanaṃ nirākāraṃ nirādhāraṃ nirāmayaṃ || nirvikalpaṃ nirākāśaṃ nityānityaṃ namāmy ahaṃ || 1 ||

niraṃjanam iti nirgataṃ aṃjanaṃ· vyaktalepanakāntigatyā
dikaṃ· yasmin sa·
msItem.explicit: || pradīpeśo ratnarājo mahāmatiś ca ratnadhṛk || ākāśagaṃjaḥ sakalamaṃgalaḥ kanakeśvaraḥ || dhamodaro so vānanda ete te navasāṃghikāḥ || ete bhikṣusaṃghā vipasyādīnāṃ koṭisaṃkhyānāṃ śiṣyāṇāṃ madhye mukhāśiṣyā bhikṣavaḥ ||

extent.measure: Formed of 5 leaves glued together end-to-end.

decoNote.desc: A Mahāyāna Buddhist pantheon, starting from the ekāmnāya and concluding with the navāmnāya.
At the bottom of the verso side, there is a drawing perhaps symbolizing a vajra.

additions.desc: Vertical running headers for each level of the diagram: 1 upāya ādibuddha· mahāvairocanaḥ ||, prajñā· prajñāpāramitā ||, etc.
R.F. stamp, at the top of the recto and in the middle of the verso, 28 mm diameter.

acquisition.p: This manuscript was sold to the BnF by Philippe-Édouard Foucaux in 1875 (acquisition registry number 6677). The description in the registry reads, Tableau contenant des formules du mysticisme bouddhique au Népâl en sanscrit manuscrit roulé sur papier du Tibet.
